Class TeacherMarkAttendanceCenterPanel

java.lang.Object
ticktocktrack.gui.TeacherMarkAttendanceCenterPanel
public class TeacherMarkAttendanceCenterPanel extends Object
The TeacherMarkAttendanceCenterPanel class is responsible for creating and managing the center panel used by teachers to mark attendance. It provides a user interface for selecting courses, sections, and programs, and marking attendance for students within those categories.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static String
    lastRefreshDate

  • Method Details

    • createPanel

      public static javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane createPanel(String defaultCourse, String defaultSection, int teacherId)
      Creates and returns a BorderPane that serves as the main user interface for marking attendance. The panel includes sections for course, section, and program selection, as well as a list of students and controls for marking attendance.
      Parameters:
      defaultCourse - The default course to select when the panel is loaded.
      defaultSection - The default section to select when the panel is loaded.
      teacherId - The ID of the teacher using this panel.
      Returns:
      A BorderPane containing the attendance marking UI components.

    • createColumn

      private static javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Student,String> createColumn(String title, String property)
      Creates a table column with the specified title and property mapping. This method is a utility for generating generic, read-only table columns.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the column, displayed in the table header.
      property - The property of the Student object that this column maps to.
      Returns:
      A TableColumn configured to display the specified property.

    • createEditableStatusColumn

      private static javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Student,String> createEditableStatusColumn()
      Creates a table column for editing attendance status. The column allows selecting predefined attendance statuses from a dropdown menu.
      Returns:
      A TableColumn configured for editable attendance status values.

    • loadStudentsBasedOnSelection

      private static void loadStudentsBasedOnSelection(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> courseComboBox, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> sectionComboBox, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Student> students)
      Loads the list of students based on the selected course and section. Updates the provided list of students to reflect the changes.
      Parameters:
      courseComboBox - The ComboBox containing the list of available courses.
      sectionComboBox - The ComboBox containing the list of available sections.
      students - The ObservableList of students to be updated with filtered data.

    • loadStudents

      private static void loadStudents(String course, String program, String section, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Student> students)
      Loads students enrolled in a specific course, program, and section into the provided list. Updates each student's attendance status for the current day.
      Parameters:
      course - The name of the course for which to load students.
      program - The program name used for filtering students.
      section - The section name used for filtering students.
      students - The ObservableList to populate with the loaded student data.

    • saveAttendance

      private static void saveAttendance(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Student> students, String course, String combinedSection)
      Saves the attendance records for the provided list of students. The attendance is associated with a specific course and section.
      Parameters:
      students - The ObservableList of students whose attendance will be saved.
      course - The name of the course for which attendance is being saved.
      combinedSection - The combined section information used to identify the group of students.
